item.title: [pi] how can i turn this into a usable int
item.dc:creator: @Svitkona Svitkona
item.description:
@Svitkona wrote:

int level;
public int getTotalLevel() {
        for (int i = 0; i < 21; i++) {
             level = level + getLevelForXP(c.playerXP[i]);
        }
        return level;
}

item.title: [pi] how can i turn this into a usable int
item.dc:creator: @emtrescue emtrescue
item.description:
@emtrescue wrote:

this is in playerassist

public void totallevelsupdate() { int totalLevel = (getLevelForXP(c.playerXP[0]) + getLevelForXP(c.playerXP[1]) + getLevelForXP(c.playerXP[2]) + getLevelForXP(c.playerXP[3]) + getLevelForXP(c.playerXP[4]) + getLevelForXP(c.playerXP[5]) + getLevelForXP(c.playerXP[6]) + getLevelForXP(c.playerXP[7]) + getLevelForXP(c.playerXP[8]) + getLevelForXP(c.playerXP[9]) + getLevelForXP(c.playerXP[10]) + getLevelForXP(c.playerXP[11]) + getLevelForXP(c.playerXP[12]) + getLevelForXP(c.playerXP[13]) + getLevelForXP(c.playerXP[14]) + getLevelForXP(c.playerXP[15]) + getLevelForXP(c.playerXP[16]) + getLevelForXP(c.playerXP[17]) + getLevelForXP(c.playerXP[18]) + getLevelForXP(c.playerXP[19]) + getLevelForXP(c.playerXP[20])); sendFrame126("Levels: "+totalLevel, 13983); }

the code is right there but how can i turn it into a usable int so i can use it in commands.java

(to clearify usable as in when u put like donor = 1;, u can use it in a command, but totalLevel is not added that way yet)
